newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: Austria cenbank says sustaining deficits is key.
newsitem.headline: Austria cenbank says sustaining deficits is key.

text.p: Austrian central bank director Adolf Wala said on Tuesday the sustainability of budget deficits was more important than strict adherence to the three percent deficit criteria for Europe's planned single currency.

"What is essential is a sustainable budget deficit. This means 3.2 percent with a certain sustainability is better than 2.9 percent with some dirty tricks," he told reporters during a banking conference.
Wala added the essential criteria for Europe's economic and monetary union (EMU) were inflation, the exchange rate and short and long term interest rates.
"They influence the stability of the euro. Fiscal criteria are not so important," he said.

The Maastricht treaty on EMU stipulates a range of economic targests for countries wanting to join the single currency, including limiting budget deficits to a target three percent of gross domestic product and public debt to 60 percent. -- Vienna newsroom, +431 53112 274
